data.title: Dead baby cockroach in soup
data.text:
We used to be a regular until I found a DEAD COCKROACH floating on top of my fried tofu. Horrified beyond imaginable. Will never EVER come again.

I will not compromise price for cleanliness. Should report to the health inspector.

data.title: Decent Pho, Reasonable price
data.text: This is a typical PHO place.  I usually don't order anything else because the other items are not as good compared to Chinese food.  They serve it hot.  Price is reasonable.  If you are looking for PHO, you will not be disapplointed.

data.title: PHO-sure, think twice before eating there!
data.text:
A Vietnamese lady recommended Pho So 1, so we went there this morning to enjoy some Pho soups.  WHOA, you must not even think about dining there - it is VERY unclean from the inside, windows, and kitchen was not clean (door was open to the outside so we saw the condition of the kitchen) - who knows what you'll get from eating the food unless you have an iron stomach.  There were 3 folding chairs outside, assume this is for waiting, that you could see people's butt imprint but dirty. 

It has a B rating in the window - that should give you a clue.  My speculation they get busy due to their affordable pricing.

PHO-sure we will not be dining there ever.

data.title: Simple but fulfilling!
data.text: We always go there for lunch when we crave for noodles. Its fast, good and bountiful.The price is really reasonable, and the pho is the best. We can always share the large bowl of pho with either spring rolls or egg rolls. Always crowded but the wait is fast. Mostly locals patronize this place and you know its good.I had been to a lot of different pho places around town and this is on the top of my list so I frequent here.

data.title: A Very Popular Vietnamese Restaurant
data.text: Depending on when you go to this place, you would have to wait in line to be seated.  It gets particularly busy during lunch time.  However, the wait usually is not too long.  Other times, it is not so bad.  If you want good Vietnamese food at a decent price and not have to wait too long for the order or food to come out, this is the place.  It's part of a Chain, perhaps family owned???  Anyway, there were a couple of other Vietnamese restaurants that had occupied that same location without much success, but this chain has been very successful since it's been there.  I highly recommend.

data.title: Authentic Vietnamese Food!
data.text:
The Pho soups are so delicious and what a variety. The fried egg rolls are so good as well as their plate selections.  Friendly and good service.  Very reasonable prices.
You pay your bill at the cashier by telling that person your table number.

data.title: average
data.text:
Been eating at the pho consome for a while now so decided to try out this new place.
We ordered the number 1 and the number 18 pho. I must say that when the pho came out was a bit disappointed on the presentation, although I must say that the pho came out really fast, literally within 5 mins after we ordered. 
The soup base tasted rather light but the staff was very generous when we requested for more lemons and basil. 
Portions were large but I must say, the sanitary conditions both in the restaurant and in the kitchen were not very pleasant.
We looked over at the other tables that ordered the dry rice noodles, portions look huge but again presentation was a bit messy. 
Will come again to try out their other dishes as their prices are actually quite cheap.

data.title: Hot Pho soup in Winter
data.text: Just landed from Vietnam and cold, feeling like to have good hot soup. Pho So 1 was the choice. Usual smell and taste make me warm and full. Quite crowded, just 10 minutes we got seats and not too long to enjoy eating.

data.title: PS1 usually good, but for some reason, this one was not at the usual standard
data.text: While I had the usual Bun, with the avocado, the service was OK. For some reason, I just didn't enjoy the visit as much. I would prefer to go to their Valley locations (VN, Simi, etc.). In this area, PS1 isn't the only Pho place anymore. If I'm around Gardena again, I would try one of the Japanese ones instead. Yes it's cheap, but there's so much more to try.

data.title: good vietnamese eggrolls
data.text: Great place for noodle soup and eggrolls!  Only downside is the cafeteria atmosphere and at time I question the etiquette.  They are not the cleanest dig I've been too.  If you like tasty food and quick service, this is the spot.  Lunch or late night quick bite to eat.

data.title: The pho was not too bad...
data.text: The pho was not too bad.  I came here with my Vietnamese friend and we had a good time.  Their menu has a lot of selections to choose from.

data.title: ヘルシーなフォー
data.text:
人気ベトナムレストランです。いつも混んでます。
フォー以外にも、生春巻き、ベトナム風鍋、普通にベトナム料理が食べれます。
スタッフも親切な方が多いです。
アメリカ料理に飽きたころヘルシー、さっぱりでいいかもしれません。付け合せのパクチーを大量投入して食します。
